headline: Bank earnings prove there's another leg in this credit cycle
summary: S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research Nathan Stovall elaborates on how he envisions earnings growth for the banking sector in 2026 and what President Trump's proposed 10% rate cap on credit cards could mean for these earnings forecasts. Also watch Nathan Stovall comment on why bank stocks may be slipping despite generally positive earnings results. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: JPM26: Atea Pharmaceuticals outlines HCV strategy centred on short-duration regimens
summary: Atea showcased its Phase III HCV programme at JPM for bemnifosbuvir/ruzasvir, positioning the regimen for test-and-treat adoption in ~1,800 patients. C-BEYOND data are expected mid-2026, with C-FORWARD results by year-end 2026.

headline: Trump credit card cap would cause once in a lifetime battle from banks
summary: While major bank stocks fall after reporting their fourth quarter earnings, President Trump's suggested 10% cap on credit card fees continues to weigh on the financial sector (XLF) and credit lenders. HSBC Head of US Financials Research Saul Martinez told Yahoo Finance on Tuesday that a policy like this would make the credit card industry largely "unprofitable." Whalen Global Advisors Chairman Chris Whalen explains how bank executives would respond to this type of legislation. Also catch Chris Whalen weigh in on the performance of Big Bank stocks in comparison to smaller counterparts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: JPMorgan Chase (JPM) Valuation Check After Earnings Beat And Apple Card Portfolio Acquisition
summary: JPMorgan Chase (JPM) just paired a solid earnings update with the planned acquisition of Goldman Sachs’s Apple Card portfolio, giving investors fresh information on both current profitability and on how the credit card business could evolve. See our latest analysis for JPMorgan Chase. Those earnings and the Apple Card deal come in a mixed share price backdrop, with a 1-day share price return of 1.04% but a 7-day share price return showing a 5.08% decline.
